title: Ticket #2806: is_the_executable used before it is set in file_transfer
description:
Coverity and prefast have both noticed that in the Win32 code path in file_transfer.cpp, the variable is_the_executable is used before it is set.

at about line 2270, this code is using the variable 

if( !is_url && perm_obj && !is_the_executable &&
it is finally set at about line 2710. Both of these bits of code are in a loop, so the code might be correct, but at the very least is_the_executable should be initialized to something, and comments should be added to indicate why we don't want to check for read access if it is the executable.
check_ins: 2012-Jun-28 13:50   Check-in [32516]: fixed a long-standing windows permissions checking bug detected by coverity #2806 (By Zach Miller )
creator: johnkn
